title: Colour Idioms
instructions: Work in pairs using one phone between you. Take turns to rephrase the sentence using the keyword given.

cards.sentence: The job was offered to her quite unexpectedly.
cards.answer: The job was offered to her out of the blue.

cards.sentence: She let him into the office and gave him a few minutes before catching him in the act of photocopying the secret documents.
cards.answer: She let him into the office and gave him one minute before catching him red-handed.

cards.sentence: Frankly, I still can't resist the temptation to have some Nutella very occasionally while making breakfast for the kids.
cards.answer: Frankly, I still can't resist the temptation to have some Nutella once in a blue moon while making breakfast for the kids.

cards.sentence: It always makes me sad when October evenings start drawing in earlier and earlier.
cards.answer: I always get the blues when October evenings start drawing in earlier and earlier.

cards.sentence: All your friends will be jealous when they see these shoes.
cards.answer: All your colleagues will be green with envy when they see these shoes.

cards.sentence: The economy is soaring, we have even paid off our state debts.
cards.answer: The economy is soaring, even the state budget is back in the black.

cards.sentence: She passed the exam with a very high mark.
cards.answer: She passed the exam with flying colours.

cards.sentence: People who drop litter in the street make me really angry.
cards.answer: People who drop litter in the street make me see red.

cards.sentence: As the lads left the studios they signed autographs for fans - who must've been happy-clappy.
cards.answer: As the lads left the studios they signed autographs for fans - who must've been tickled pink.

cards.sentence: I was allowed to leave Barcelona FC under certain conditions, which have been met.
cards.targetLanguage: to give the green light to something
cards.answer: Barcelona FC gave me a green light to leave under certain conditions, which have been met.

cards.sentence: If you owe money to your bank, you get charged 30p for each transaction.
cards.answer: If you are in the red, you get charged 30p for each transaction.
